errors.usedFor: Single `&` or `|` without being doubled, other invalid characters
errors.example: unexpected character '&', did you mean '&&'?
errors.howToFix: Remove or replace the illegal character from your source code. EZ only supports standard ASCII characters for code.

errors.example: unexpected character '|', did you mean '||'?
errors.howToFix: Use `||` for logical OR operations, not a single `|` character.

errors.example: unclosed multi-line comment
errors.howToFix: Add `*/` to close your multi-line comment.

errors.example: unclosed string literal
errors.howToFix: Add a closing `"` to terminate your string literal.

errors.example: unclosed character literal
errors.howToFix: Add a closing `'` to terminate your character literal.

errors.example: invalid escape sequence '\x' in string
errors.howToFix: Use valid escape sequences: `\n`, `\t`, `\\`, `\"`, `\r`. Remove or fix the invalid escape sequence.

errors.usedFor: Unknown escape like `\x` in char literal
errors.example: invalid escape sequence '\x' in character literal
errors.howToFix: Use valid escape sequences in character literals: `\n`, `\t`, `\\`, `\'`, `\r`.

errors.example: empty character literal
errors.howToFix: Character literals must contain exactly one character. Use `' '` for space or another valid character.

errors.example: character literal must contain exactly one character
errors.howToFix: Character literals can only contain one character. Use a string (`"..."`) for multiple characters.

errors.example: invalid number format: multiple decimal points
errors.howToFix: Check your number literal for typos. Ensure it follows valid integer or float format.

errors.example: consecutive underscores not allowed in numeric literals
errors.howToFix: Use single underscores as separators in numbers: `1_000_000` not `1__000`.

errors.example: numeric literal cannot start with underscore
errors.howToFix: Numbers cannot start with underscore. Use `1_000` not `_1000`.

errors.example: numeric literal cannot end with underscore
errors.howToFix: Numbers cannot end with underscore. Use `1_000` not `1000_`.

errors.example: underscore cannot appear immediately before decimal point
errors.howToFix: Remove underscore before the decimal point. Use `3.14` not `3_.14`.

errors.example: underscore cannot appear immediately after decimal point
errors.howToFix: Remove underscore after the decimal point. Use `3.14` not `3._14`.

errors.example: invalid number format: decimal point must be followed by digits
errors.howToFix: Add digits after the decimal point. Use `3.0` not `3.`.

errors.example: raw string literal not closed

errors.usedFor: Token found where another was expected
errors.example: unexpected token 'foo'
errors.howToFix: Check your syntax around the reported location. You may have a typo or missing punctuation.

errors.example: expected RPAREN, got IDENT instead
errors.howToFix: Add the expected token (semicolon, brace, parenthesis, etc.) at the indicated location.

errors.example: expected expression after '='
errors.howToFix: Provide an expression where expected. Check for incomplete statements or missing values.

errors.example: unclosed brace - expected '}'
errors.howToFix: Add a closing `}` to match your opening brace.

errors.example: unclosed parenthesis - expected ')'
errors.howToFix: Add a closing `)` to match your opening parenthesis.

errors.example: unclosed bracket - expected ']'
errors.howToFix: Add a closing `]` to match your opening bracket.

errors.example: unclosed interpolation in string
errors.howToFix: Add `}` to close your string interpolation `${...}`.

errors.usedFor: Assignment to non-assignable (not identifier, index, or member)
errors.example: invalid assignment target: cannot assign to *ast.IntegerValue
errors.howToFix: You can only assign to variables, array elements, or struct fields. Check the left side of your assignment.

errors.example: file-scoped 'using' must come before all declarations
errors.howToFix: Move your `using` statement to the top of the file, before any variable or function declarations.

errors.example: cannot use module 'math' before importing it
errors.howToFix: Import a module with `import @module` before using it with `use @module`.

errors.example: const 'x' must be initialized with a value
errors.howToFix: Constants must be initialized. Add `= value` to your const declaration.

errors.example: duplicate parameter name 'x'
errors.howToFix: Rename one of the duplicate parameters to have a unique name.

errors.example: duplicate field name 'x' in struct
errors.howToFix: Rename one of the duplicate struct fields to have a unique name.

errors.example: parameter 'x' is missing a type
errors.howToFix: Add a type annotation to your parameter: `do foo(x int)` not `do foo(x)`.

errors.example: expected return type after '->'
errors.howToFix: Add a return type after the arrow: `do foo() -> int { ... }`.

errors.message: enum must have at least one value
errors.example: enum 'Status' must have at least one value
errors.howToFix: Add at least one value to your enum declaration.

errors.example: unexpected trailing comma in array literal
errors.howToFix: Remove the trailing comma from your array literal: `{1, 2, 3}` not `{1, 2, 3,}`.

errors.example: unexpected trailing comma in function call
errors.howToFix: Remove the trailing comma from your function call: `foo(1, 2)` not `foo(1, 2,)`.

errors.example: function declarations are not allowed inside functions
errors.howToFix: Move the inner function outside of the outer function. EZ does not allow nested function definitions.

errors.example: 'temp' is a reserved keyword and cannot be used as a variable name
errors.howToFix: Choose a different name. Reserved words like `if`, `for`, `while`, etc. cannot be used as variable names.

errors.example: 'len' is a reserved keyword and cannot be used as a function name
errors.howToFix: Choose a different function name. Built-in names and reserved words cannot be used.

errors.example: 'int' is a reserved keyword and cannot be used as a type name
errors.howToFix: Choose a different type name. Built-in types and reserved words cannot be used.

errors.example: 'x' is already declared in this scope
errors.howToFix: Rename one of the duplicate declarations or remove the redundant one.

errors.example: expected type name, got RBRACE
errors.howToFix: Use a valid type name: `int`, `float`, `string`, `bool`, `char`, or a defined struct/enum name.

errors.example: expected integer for array size, got STRING
errors.howToFix: Array size must be a positive integer literal: `var arr [5]int` not `var arr [x]int`.

errors.example: enum type attributes must be primitive types (int, float, or string), got 'Custom'
errors.howToFix: Enum base types must be primitive: `int`, `float`, or `string`.

errors.example: could not parse "abc" as integer
errors.howToFix: Check your integer literal for invalid characters or overflow.

errors.example: could not parse "1.2.3" as float
errors.howToFix: Check your float literal for invalid characters or formatting issues.

errors.example: expected identifier or @ignore, got RBRACE
errors.howToFix: Provide a valid identifier (name) where expected. Names must start with a letter or underscore.

errors.example: expected '{' after condition
errors.howToFix: Add a block statement `{ ... }` where expected.

errors.example: string enums require explicit values for all members
errors.howToFix: String enums need explicit values: `const Colors enum { RED = "red", BLUE = "blue" }`.

errors.message: const array must have fixed size
errors.usedFor: Declaring const array without explicit size
errors.example: const array must have a fixed size
errors.howToFix: Constant arrays must have a fixed size: `const arr [3]int = {1, 2, 3}`.

errors.usedFor: Using a reserved keyword or builtin name as a function parameter
errors.example: parameter name 'int' is reserved
errors.howToFix: Choose a different parameter name that is not a reserved keyword or builtin.

errors.usedFor: Using a reserved keyword or builtin name as a struct field
errors.example: struct field name 'const' is reserved
errors.howToFix: Choose a different field name that is not a reserved keyword or builtin.

errors.usedFor: Using a reserved keyword or builtin name as an enum value
errors.example: enum value name 'true' is reserved
errors.howToFix: Choose a different enum value name that is not a reserved keyword or builtin.

errors.message: import must be at file level
errors.usedFor: Import statement inside a function or block
errors.example: import statement must be at file level, not inside a function
errors.howToFix: Move the import statement to the top of the file, outside of any function or block.

errors.usedFor: Using a reserved keyword or builtin type as a struct name
errors.example: struct name 'int' is reserved
errors.howToFix: Choose a different struct name that is not a reserved keyword or builtin type.

errors.usedFor: Using a reserved keyword or builtin type as an enum name
errors.example: enum name 'bool' is reserved
errors.howToFix: Choose a different enum name that is not a reserved keyword or builtin type.

errors.message: required parameter after parameter with default
errors.usedFor: Declaring a required parameter after an optional parameter with a default value
errors.example: required parameter 'y' cannot come after parameter 'x' which has a default value
errors.howToFix: Move required parameters before parameters with default values. Required parameters must come first.

errors.message: mutable parameter cannot have default value
errors.usedFor: Declaring a mutable (&) parameter with a default value
errors.example: mutable parameter '&p' cannot have a default value
errors.howToFix: Remove either the `&` modifier or the default value. Mutable parameters cannot have defaults.

errors.message: when statement requires a default case
errors.usedFor: When statement without a default case (unless using #strict with enum)
errors.example: when statement requires a default case
errors.howToFix: Add a `default { }` case to handle values not covered by `is` cases, or use `#strict` with an enum.

errors.message: strict when statement cannot have a default case
errors.usedFor: #strict when statement that includes a default case
errors.example: strict when statement cannot have a default case
errors.howToFix: Remove the `default` case. Strict when statements must cover all enum values explicitly.

errors.message: duplicate case value in when statement
errors.usedFor: Same value appears in multiple `is` cases
errors.example: duplicate case value '1' in when statement
errors.howToFix: Remove the duplicate case value. Each value can only appear once in a when statement.

errors.message: float type not allowed in when statement
errors.usedFor: Using a float value as a when condition
errors.example: float type not allowed in when statement
errors.howToFix: Use `if/or/otherwise` for float comparisons instead of `when`. Floats are not exact and shouldn't be used for pattern matching.

errors.message: strict attribute only allowed on enum when statements
errors.usedFor: #strict attribute on a when statement that doesn't match an enum
errors.example: #strict can only be used with enum when statements
errors.howToFix: Remove the `#strict` attribute. It can only be used when the when condition is an enum value.

errors.message: strict when statement missing enum case
errors.usedFor: #strict when statement that doesn't cover all enum values
errors.example: strict when statement missing case for 'Status.PENDING'
errors.howToFix: Add an `is` case for each enum value. Strict when statements must be exhaustive.

errors.message: when condition must be a value, not a type name
errors.usedFor: Using a type name instead of a variable as when condition
errors.example: when condition must be a value, not a type name 'int'
errors.howToFix: Use a variable or expression that evaluates to a value, not a type name.

errors.message: when condition cannot be a boolean. Use if/or/otherwise instead
errors.usedFor: Using a boolean value or expression as when condition
errors.example: when condition cannot be a boolean. Use if/or/otherwise instead
errors.howToFix: Use `if/or/otherwise` for boolean conditions. The `when` statement is for pattern matching on discrete values.

errors.message: when condition cannot be nil. Use if/otherwise to check for nil
errors.example: when condition cannot be nil. Use if/otherwise to check for nil
errors.howToFix: Use `if value == nil { } otherwise { }` to check for nil values.

errors.message: when condition cannot be an array or map
errors.usedFor: Using an array or map as when condition
errors.example: when condition cannot be an array or map
errors.howToFix: Arrays and maps cannot be used as when conditions. Use `if/or/otherwise` for collection comparisons.

errors.message: #suppress can only be applied to function declarations or file level
errors.usedFor: Using #suppress attribute on non-function declarations (except file-level #suppress(ALL))
errors.example: #suppress can only be applied to function declarations or at file level with ALL
errors.howToFix: Move the #suppress attribute to a function declaration, or use #suppress(ALL) at the top of the file to suppress all warnings in that file.

errors.usedFor: Using #suppress with an invalid or unknown warning code
errors.example: warning code 'W9999' cannot be suppressed
errors.howToFix: Use a valid warning code with #suppress. Valid codes are W1001-W4001, or use ALL to suppress all warnings.

errors.message: type definitions must be at file level
errors.example: type definitions must be at file level
type mismatch: expected int, got string
errors.howToFix: Ensure the value type matches the expected type. Use explicit type conversion if needed.

errors.example: unknown operator: STRING * STRING
errors.howToFix: Use an operator that is valid for this type. For example, you cannot use `*` on strings.

errors.example: index must be an integer, got STRING
errors.howToFix: Array/string indices must be integers. Convert your index to an integer.

errors.usedFor: Assigning wrong type to string index
errors.example: can only assign character to string index, got INTEGER
errors.howToFix: The assigned value must match the array's element type.

errors.example: cannot convert "abc" to int: invalid integer format
errors.howToFix: The value cannot be converted to an integer. Check the source value type.

errors.example: cannot convert "abc" to float: invalid float format
errors.howToFix: The value cannot be converted to a float. Check the source value type.

errors.example: cannot convert ARRAY to int
errors.howToFix: Arrays cannot be converted to scalar values. Access individual elements instead.

errors.example: undefined type 'Foo'
errors.howToFix: Define the type before using it, or check for typos in the type name.

errors.example: undefined type 'Custom' in struct 'Person'
errors.howToFix: Ensure all field types in your struct are defined before the struct declaration.

errors.example: undefined type 'Foo' for parameter 'x'
errors.howToFix: Define the parameter type or check for typos.

errors.example: undefined return type 'Bar' in function 'foo'
errors.howToFix: Define the return type or check for typos.

errors.message: return type does not match declaration
errors.example: return type mismatch: expected int, got string
errors.howToFix: Ensure your return value matches the declared return type.

errors.example: wrong number of return values: expected 2, got 1
errors.howToFix: Return the correct number of values as declared in the function signature.

errors.example: incompatible types for operator '+': INTEGER and STRING
errors.howToFix: Both operands must be compatible types. Convert one operand to match the other.

errors.example: not a function: INTEGER
errors.howToFix: Only functions can be called. Check that you're calling a function, not a variable.

errors.example: index operator not supported for STRUCT
errors.howToFix: Only arrays, strings, and maps can be indexed with `[]`.

errors.example: for_each requires array or string, got INTEGER
errors.howToFix: Only arrays, strings, maps, and ranges can be used in `for_each` loops.

errors.example: array type requires value in {} format, got scalar
errors.howToFix: Initialize arrays with array literals: `{1, 2, 3}` not a single value.

errors.message: cannot assign signed type to unsigned
errors.usedFor: Assigning signed int to unsigned int type
errors.example: cannot assign signed type 'int' to unsigned type 'uint'
errors.howToFix: Cannot assign a signed type to an unsigned variable. Use explicit conversion or change the variable type.

errors.message: cannot assign negative value to unsigned type
errors.usedFor: Assigning negative literal to unsigned int type
errors.example: cannot assign negative value -5 to unsigned type 'uint'
errors.howToFix: Unsigned types cannot hold negative values. Use a signed type or ensure the value is non-negative.

errors.message: cannot change type of variable after declaration
errors.usedFor: Assigning a value outside the byte range (0-255) to a byte variable
errors.example: byte value must be between 0 and 255, got 300
errors.howToFix: Ensure the value assigned to a byte is within the valid range of 0 to 255.

errors.usedFor: Array literal for byte array contains a value outside 0-255
errors.example: byte array element must be between 0 and 255, got 256
errors.howToFix: Ensure all elements in a byte array literal are within the valid range of 0 to 255.

errors.usedFor: Passing a const variable to a function parameter declared with &
errors.example: cannot pass immutable variable 'config' to mutable parameter '&p'
errors.howToFix: Use a `temp` variable instead of `const`, or remove the `&` from the parameter if mutation is not needed.

errors.usedFor: Function declares return type but has no return statement
errors.example: function 'calculate' must return a value of type 'int'
errors.howToFix: Add a return statement with a value matching the declared return type.

errors.message: byte value must be between 0 and 255
errors.usedFor: Assigning a value outside the byte range (0-255) to a byte variable
errors.example: byte value must be between 0 and 255, got 300
errors.howToFix: Ensure the value assigned to a byte is within the valid range of 0 to 255.

errors.message: byte array element must be between 0 and 255
errors.usedFor: Array literal for byte array contains a value outside 0-255
errors.example: byte array element must be between 0 and 255, got 256
errors.howToFix: Ensure all elements in a byte array literal are within the valid range of 0 to 255.

errors.message: cannot pass immutable variable to mutable parameter
errors.usedFor: Passing a const variable to a function parameter declared with &
errors.example: cannot pass immutable variable 'config' to mutable parameter '&p'
errors.howToFix: Use a `temp` variable instead of `const`, or remove the `&` from the parameter if mutation is not needed.

errors.message: enum members must all have the same type
errors.usedFor: Enum declaration with members of different types
errors.example: enum members must all have the same type
errors.howToFix: Ensure all enum members have the same underlying type (all ints or all strings).

errors.message: float-based enum cannot be used as map key
errors.usedFor: Using a float-based enum as a map key
errors.example: float-based enum cannot be used as map key
errors.howToFix: Use an int or string-based enum for map keys. Float-based enums cannot be used as map keys due to precision issues.

errors.message: type definition cannot be used as a runtime value
errors.example: type definition cannot be used as a runtime value

errors.message: function cannot be used as a value without calling it
errors.example: function cannot be used as a value without calling it

errors.message: cannot compare values from different enum types
errors.example: cannot compare values from different enum types
enum contains duplicate values

errors.message: 'any' type is reserved for internal use
errors.example: 'any' type is reserved for internal use
identifier not found: 'foo'
errors.howToFix: Declare the variable before using it, or check for typos in the variable name.

errors.example: undefined function: 'foo'
errors.howToFix: Define the function before calling it, import the module containing it, or check for typos.

errors.message: field does not exist on type
errors.example: field 'foo' not found
errors.howToFix: Check that the field exists on the struct. Verify the field name spelling.

errors.example: enum value 'BAR' not found in enum 'Status'
errors.howToFix: Use a value that exists in the enum definition.

errors.example: 'bar' not found in module 'math'
errors.howToFix: Check that the function or constant exists in the module. Verify the name spelling.

errors.message: type not found for new expression
errors.example: undefined type: 'Foo'
errors.howToFix: Define the struct before using `new` with it.

errors.example: cannot use 'math': module not imported
errors.howToFix: Add `import @modulename` at the top of your file.

errors.example: function 'len' found in multiple modules: arrays, strings
errors.howToFix: Use the module prefix to disambiguate: `module.function()` instead of just `function()`.

errors.example: Program must define a main() function
errors.howToFix: Add a `do main() { }` function as the entry point for your program.

errors.example: nil reference: cannot access member 'x' of nil
errors.howToFix: Check that the value is not nil before accessing members. Use conditional checks.

errors.message: type does not support member access
errors.example: member access not supported on type INTEGER
errors.howToFix: Only structs and modules support member access with `.`. Check the value type.

errors.example: variable shadows a type definition
variable shadows a function
variable shadows an imported module

errors.message: variable shadows a function from a used module
errors.example: variable shadows a function from a used module
division by zero
errors.howToFix: Check that the divisor is not zero before dividing.

errors.example: modulo by zero
errors.howToFix: Check that the divisor is not zero before using modulo.

errors.example: index out of bounds: attempted to access index 100, but valid range is 0-4
errors.howToFix: Ensure your index is within valid range: `0` to `len(array) - 1`.

errors.example: index out of bounds: array is empty (length 0)
errors.howToFix: Check that the collection is not empty before indexing.

errors.example: nil reference: cannot use nil with operator '+'
errors.howToFix: Check that the value is not nil before performing operations on it.

errors.example: cannot assign to immutable variable 'x' (declared as const)
errors.howToFix: Use `var` instead of `const` if you need to modify the variable, or remove the assignment.

errors.example: cannot modify immutable array (declared as const)
errors.howToFix: Use `var` instead of `const` for the array if you need to modify it.

errors.example: wrong number of arguments: expected 3, got 2
errors.howToFix: Pass the correct number of arguments as defined in the function signature.

errors.example: break statement outside loop
errors.howToFix: `break` can only be used inside `for`, `while`, or `for_each` loops.

errors.example: continue statement outside loop
errors.howToFix: `continue` can only be used inside `for`, `while`, or `for_each` loops.

errors.example: return value from function not used (use @ignore to discard)
errors.howToFix: Assign the return value to a variable or explicitly ignore it if not needed.

errors.example: expected 2 values, got 1
errors.howToFix: Ensure the number of variables matches the number of values in multiple assignment.

errors.example: range start must be integer
errors.howToFix: Range start must be an integer: `0..10` not `"a"..10`.

errors.example: range end must be integer
errors.howToFix: Range end must be an integer: `0..10` not `0.."z"`.

errors.usedFor: Using ++ or -- on a non-variable expression
errors.example: postfix operator requires an identifier, got literal
errors.howToFix: Use postfix operators (++ or --) only on variables, not on literals or expressions.

errors.usedFor: Attempting to modify a parameter not declared with &
errors.example: cannot modify read-only parameter 'p'
errors.howToFix: Add `&` before the parameter name to make it mutable: `do foo(&p Person)` instead of `do foo(p Person)`.

errors.message: cannot modify field of const struct
errors.usedFor: Attempting to modify a field of a struct instance that was declared as const (immutable)
errors.example: cannot modify field of immutable struct 'p' (declared as const)
errors.howToFix: Use `temp` instead of `const` when declaring a struct instance that you need to modify.

errors.usedFor: Function calls itself too many times without returning
errors.example: maximum recursion depth exceeded (limit: 1000)
errors.howToFix: Add a base case to your recursive function to stop the recursion, or rewrite using iteration.

errors.usedFor: Using a non-integer value as the step argument in range()
errors.example: range step must be an integer, got FLOAT
errors.howToFix: Use an integer value for the step argument in range(). Convert to int if needed.

errors.message: value checked against range must be integer
errors.usedFor: Using `in range()` with a non-integer value
errors.example: cannot check if float is in range: value must be integer
errors.howToFix: Convert the value to an integer before checking if it's in a range, or use comparison operators instead.

errors.usedFor: Program explicitly called `panic()` to terminate execution
errors.example: [PANIC] something went wrong
errors.howToFix: Investigate the panic message to understand why the program terminated. Fix the underlying condition that caused the panic.

errors.usedFor: An `assert()` check failed because the condition evaluated to false
errors.example: [ASSERT] x must be positive
errors.howToFix: Check that the asserted condition holds true. Review the values being tested and fix the logic that caused the assertion to fail.

errors.example: postfix operator needs integer operand

errors.usedFor: A imports B, B imports A
errors.example: circular import detected: a.ez -> b.ez -> a.ez
errors.howToFix: Restructure your modules to remove the circular dependency. Consider creating a shared module.

errors.example: module 'foo' not found
errors.howToFix: Check the module path and name. Ensure the module file exists.

errors.example: invalid module 'foo': parse error
errors.howToFix: Check the module file for syntax errors.

errors.example: failed to load module 'foo': permission denied
errors.howToFix: Check file permissions and ensure the module file is readable.

errors.message: module name does not match directory
errors.usedFor: Module declaration name differs from directory name
errors.example: module name 'foo' does not match directory name 'bar'
errors.howToFix: The `module` declaration must match the directory name containing the file.

errors.message: files in directory declare different module names
errors.usedFor: Multiple files in same directory declare different module names
errors.example: files in directory declare conflicting module names: 'foo' vs 'bar'
errors.howToFix: All files in a directory must declare the same module name.

errors.message: cannot import from internal/ directory outside package
errors.usedFor: Attempting to import internal module from outside its parent package
errors.example: cannot import internal module 'pkg/internal/util' from outside 'pkg'
errors.howToFix: Files in `internal/` directories can only be imported by files in the same package.

errors.usedFor: Attempting to modify a module's exported member
errors.example: cannot assign to module member 'math.PI'
errors.howToFix: Module-level constants and exports cannot be reassigned from outside the module.

errors.message: cannot access private member from outside module
errors.usedFor: Accessing private (unexported) member from another module
errors.example: cannot access private member 'helper' from outside module 'utils'
errors.howToFix: Private members (lowercase names) cannot be accessed from outside the module. Use exported members instead.

errors.usedFor: Wrong number of args to stdlib function
errors.example: len() takes exactly 1 argument, got 2
errors.howToFix: Check the function signature and pass the correct number of arguments.

errors.example: arrays.len() requires an array
errors.howToFix: Pass an array to this function.

errors.example: strings.len() requires a string argument
errors.howToFix: Pass a string to this function.

errors.example: arrays.get() requires an integer index
errors.howToFix: Pass an integer to this function.

errors.example: expected number, got STRING
errors.howToFix: Pass an integer or float to this function.

errors.example: arrays.map() requires a function
errors.howToFix: Pass a function reference to this function.

errors.example: maps.keys() requires a map argument
errors.howToFix: Pass a map to this function.

errors.example: expected boolean, got STRING
errors.howToFix: Pass a boolean (`true` or `false`) to this function.

errors.example: expected char, got STRING
errors.howToFix: Pass a character to this function.

errors.usedFor: Argument value out of expected range or format
errors.example: invalid argument value
errors.howToFix: Check the function documentation for valid argument values.

errors.example: argument cannot be negative
errors.howToFix: Pass a non-negative value (zero or positive).

errors.example: argument cannot be zero
errors.howToFix: Pass a non-zero value.

errors.example: argument cannot be empty
errors.howToFix: Pass a non-empty collection or string.

errors.example: cannot convert STRING to int
errors.howToFix: Ensure the value can be converted to the target type.

errors.example: len() not supported for INTEGER
errors.howToFix: `len()` only works on arrays, strings, and maps.

errors.usedFor: I/O operation attempts to access a non-existent file or directory
errors.example: file or directory not found: open /path/to/missing.txt: no such file or directory
errors.howToFix: Verify the file path is correct and the file exists. Use `io.exists()` to check if a path exists before attempting operations.

errors.usedFor: Program lacks sufficient permissions for file operation
errors.example: permission denied: open /etc/shadow: permission denied
errors.howToFix: Check file and directory permissions. Ensure the program has appropriate read/write/execute permissions.

errors.example: io.remove() cannot remove directories, use io.remove_dir() instead
errors.howToFix: Use `io.remove_dir()` to remove empty directories or `io.remove_all()` for recursive deletion.

errors.example: io.remove_dir() can only remove directories, use io.remove() for files
errors.howToFix: Use `io.remove()` to remove files. Use `io.is_file()` to check if a path is a file.

errors.message: cannot remove root or home directory
errors.usedFor: `io.remove_all()` called on root or home directory
errors.example: io.remove_all() cannot remove root or home directory for safety
errors.howToFix: Never attempt to recursively delete root or home directories. Use more specific paths for deletion operations.

errors.usedFor: `io.copy()` called with a directory as the source path
errors.example: io.copy() cannot copy directories, only files
errors.howToFix: Use `io.copy()` only for individual files. For directory copying, iterate through contents and copy files individually.

errors.usedFor: Attempting to create a file or directory that already exists
errors.example: file or directory already exists: mkdir /existing/dir: file exists
errors.howToFix: Check if the file/directory exists with `io.exists()` before creation. Choose a different name or remove the existing one first.

errors.example: directory not empty: remove /path/to/dir: directory not empty
errors.howToFix: Remove all files and subdirectories first, or use `io.remove_all()` for recursive deletion (use with caution).

errors.usedFor: Setting, getting, or unsetting an environment variable fails
errors.example: environment variable operation failed: invalid variable name
errors.howToFix: Ensure environment variable names are valid (no `=` or null characters) and not empty.

errors.usedFor: System cannot determine the current working directory
errors.example: failed to get current directory: getwd: no such file or directory
errors.howToFix: Ensure the current working directory exists and you have permission to access it.

errors.usedFor: Program cannot change to the specified directory
errors.example: failed to change directory: chdir /nonexistent: no such file or directory
errors.howToFix: Verify the target directory exists with `io.exists()` and `io.is_dir()`. Check that you have execute permission on the directory.

errors.example: failed to get hostname
errors.howToFix: Verify your system's hostname configuration. Check `/etc/hostname` on Linux systems.

errors.usedFor: System cannot determine the current user's username
errors.example: failed to get username
errors.howToFix: Verify the current user exists in the system's user database. Check `/etc/passwd` on Linux systems.

errors.usedFor: System cannot determine the user's home directory
errors.example: io.expand_path(): failed to get home directory
errors.howToFix: Ensure the HOME environment variable is set and the user's home directory exists.

errors.usedFor: os.exec() or os.exec_output() cannot find the specified command
errors.example: os.exec(): command not found: 'nonexistent_command'
errors.howToFix: Verify the command exists and is in your PATH. Use the full path to the executable if needed.

errors.usedFor: os.exec() or os.exec_output() command returned a non-zero exit code
errors.example: os.exec_output(): command failed with exit code 1
errors.howToFix: Check the command's error output for details. The command may have failed due to invalid arguments or permissions.

errors.usedFor: Passing a negative value to `sleep_seconds()`, `sleep_milliseconds()`, or `sleep_nanoseconds()`
errors.example: sleep_seconds(): duration cannot be negative
errors.howToFix: Pass a non-negative value as the sleep duration. Use 0 if you don't want to sleep.

errors.usedFor: Converting a float to int when the value is too large, NaN, or Infinity
errors.example: int(): float value too large for int64
errors.howToFix: Ensure the float value is within the valid int64 range before converting. Check for NaN/Infinity values first.

errors.usedFor: Empty string passed as a file path to an I/O function
errors.example: io.read_file(): path cannot be empty
errors.howToFix: Ensure path variables are initialized before use. Add validation to check for empty paths before I/O operations.

errors.usedFor: File path contains a null byte character (security risk)
errors.example: io.read_file(): path contains null byte
errors.howToFix: Remove null bytes from the path string. Sanitize user input before using it in file paths.

errors.usedFor: `io.read_file()` or similar called with a directory path
errors.example: io.read_file(): cannot read directory as file
errors.howToFix: Use `io.read_dir()` to list directory contents. Verify the path points to a file with `io.is_file()`.

errors.usedFor: io.glob() called with an invalid pattern
errors.example: io.glob(): invalid pattern syntax: unexpected '['
errors.howToFix: Check your glob pattern syntax. Valid patterns use `*` (any chars), `?` (single char), `**` (recursive), and `[...]` (character class).

errors.usedFor: Attempting to perform an operation on an already-closed file handle
errors.example: io.read(): file handle is closed
errors.howToFix: Track file handle state and avoid operations after closing. Re-open the file if you need to perform more operations.

errors.usedFor: Catch-all for I/O failures not covered by more specific error codes
errors.example: io error during write: disk full
errors.howToFix: Read the detailed error message for the specific cause. Check available disk space and verify file system is not read-only.

errors.message: cannot take square root of negative number
errors.example: math.sqrt() cannot take negative number
errors.howToFix: Pass a non-negative number to `math.sqrt()`. Use `math.abs()` first if needed.

errors.example: math.log() requires positive number
errors.howToFix: Pass a positive number (greater than zero) to logarithm functions.

errors.message: trigonometric function input out of valid range
errors.example: math.asin() requires value between -1 and 1
errors.howToFix: Ensure the input is within the valid range for the trigonometric function.

errors.example: math.factorial() requires non-negative integer
errors.howToFix: Pass a non-negative integer to `math.factorial()`.

errors.example: math.factorial() overflow for n > 20
errors.howToFix: Use a smaller input value. Factorial of 20 is the maximum for 64-bit integers.

errors.example: random.int() range is invalid: max must be greater than min
errors.howToFix: Ensure the minimum is less than the maximum in random range functions. For `random.int(max)`, max must be > 0.

errors.usedFor: math.map_range() called with equal in_min and in_max values
errors.example: math.map_range() requires in_min != in_max to avoid division by zero
errors.howToFix: Ensure in_min and in_max are different values to avoid division by zero.

errors.usedFor: Operations on empty array like pop, shift, min, max, avg
errors.example: operation requires non-empty array
errors.howToFix: Check that the array is not empty before performing the operation using `len(arr) > 0`.

errors.example: operation requires numeric array
errors.howToFix: This operation requires an array of numbers (integers or floats).

errors.example: arrays.range() step cannot be zero
errors.howToFix: Range step must be non-zero. Use a positive or negative integer.

errors.message: chunk size must be greater than zero
errors.example: arrays.chunk() size must be greater than zero
errors.howToFix: Chunk size must be greater than zero.

errors.message: range start must be less than or equal to end
errors.example: range(10, 5): start must be <= end
errors.howToFix: Ensure the start value is less than or equal to the end value. Swap the arguments if needed.

errors.example: strings.repeat() count cannot be negative
errors.howToFix: Pass a non-negative integer as the repeat count.

errors.usedFor: random.choice() or random.sample() called on an empty array
errors.example: random.choice(): cannot select from empty array
errors.howToFix: Ensure the array has at least one element before selecting. Use `len(arr) > 0` to check first.

errors.usedFor: Accessing a character at an invalid index in a string
errors.example: string index out of bounds: index 10 on string of length 5
errors.howToFix: Ensure the index is within the valid range (0 to len(str)-1). Check string length before indexing.

errors.usedFor: Attempting to index an empty string
errors.example: cannot index empty string
errors.howToFix: Ensure the string is not empty before indexing. Use `len(str) > 0` to check first.

errors.example: time.parse() failed: invalid format
errors.howToFix: Ensure the time string matches the expected format. Check for typos in the date/time string.

errors.message: map key must be a hashable type
errors.usedFor: Using non-hashable type (array, map, struct) as map key
errors.example: map key must be a hashable type, got ARRAY
errors.howToFix: Map keys must be hashable types: `string`, `int`, `float`, `bool`, or `char`. Arrays and maps cannot be keys.

errors.usedFor: Attempting to modify a const map
errors.example: cannot modify immutable map (declared as const)
errors.howToFix: Use `var` instead of `const` for the map if you need to modify it.

errors.example: key 'foo' not found in map
errors.howToFix: Check if the key exists using `maps.contains(m, key)` before accessing.

errors.message: map entry must be a [key, value] pair
errors.usedFor: Invalid format when creating a map from entries
errors.example: map entry must be a [key, value] pair
errors.howToFix: Ensure each map entry is a two-element array containing [key, value].

errors.message: map value is not hashable and cannot become a key
errors.usedFor: Using maps.invert() when values are not hashable types
errors.example: map value is not hashable and cannot become a key
errors.howToFix: Map keys must be hashable (string, int, float, bool, char). Values like arrays, maps, or structs cannot become keys.

errors.example: invalid JSON syntax

errors.message: type cannot be converted to JSON
errors.example: type cannot be converted to JSON

errors.message: JSON object keys must be strings
errors.example: JSON object keys must be strings
variable 'x' is declared but never used
errors.howToFix: Use the variable, remove it, or suppress with `#suppress(W1001)`.

errors.example: module 'math' is imported but never used
errors.howToFix: Use the imported module or remove the import.

errors.example: function 'helper' is declared but never called
errors.howToFix: Call the function or remove it.

errors.usedFor: Function parameter never referenced in body
errors.example: parameter 'x' is declared but never used
errors.howToFix: Use the parameter, prefix with `_` to indicate intentionally unused, or suppress with `#suppress(W1004)`.

errors.example: unreachable code after return/break/continue
errors.howToFix: Remove the unreachable code or restructure your control flow. Suppress with `#suppress(W2001)`.
errors.suppressible: Suppress with #suppress(W2001) at function declaration site OR #suppress(ALL) at top of file

errors.usedFor: Inner scope variable with same name as outer
errors.example: variable 'x' shadows variable in outer scope
errors.howToFix: Rename the inner variable to avoid confusion, or suppress with `#suppress(W2002)`.

errors.usedFor: Function with return type but no return
errors.example: Function 'foo' declares return type(s) but has no return statement
errors.howToFix: Ensure all code paths return a value, or suppress with `#suppress(W2003)`.
errors.suppressible: Suppress with #suppress(W2003) at function declaration site OR #suppress(ALL) at top of file

errors.example: implicit conversion from int to float
errors.howToFix: Use explicit type conversion to make the intent clear, or suppress with `#suppress(W2004)`.

errors.usedFor: Use of deprecated syntax or function
errors.example: feature 'xyz' is deprecated, use 'abc' instead
errors.howToFix: Update to use the recommended alternative, or suppress with `#suppress(W2005)`.

errors.usedFor: Arithmetic on byte values that may exceed 0-255 range
errors.example: byte arithmetic may overflow: result could exceed 255
errors.howToFix: Ensure byte arithmetic results stay within 0-255 range, or use a larger integer type.

errors.message: variable shadows global variable or constant
errors.example: variable shadows global variable or constant
if statement has empty body
errors.howToFix: Add code to the block, add a comment explaining why it's empty, or suppress with `#suppress(W3001)`.

errors.example: condition 'true' is always true
errors.howToFix: Simplify your condition or remove the check entirely. Suppress with `#suppress(W3002)`.

errors.usedFor: Declaring a fixed-size array but providing fewer elements than the declared size
errors.example: array declared with size 10 but only 3 elements provided
errors.howToFix: Initialize all elements of a fixed-size array, or suppress with `#suppress(W3003)`.
errors.suppressible: Suppress with #suppress(W3003) at function declaration site OR #suppress(ALL) at top of file

errors.message: module name does not match directory name
errors.usedFor: Warning when module declaration name differs from directory name
errors.example: module name 'foo' does not match directory name 'bar'
errors.howToFix: Rename the module to match the directory name, or rename the directory.
